fields.summary: NullReferenceException in OrderProcessor.ProcessOrder when Items is null
fields.description:
h2. Environment
* Language: C#
* Component: OrderProcessing
* Framework: .NET 6.0
* OS: Windows 11

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Order object with null Items property
# Call ProcessOrder(order) method
# Observe NullReferenceException

h2. Expected Behavior
The method should validate the order object and handle null Items collection gracefully, either by returning an error or initializing an empty collection.

h2. Actual Behavior
The code throws NullReferenceException when attempting to access order.Items without null checking.

{code:csharp}
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at OrderProcessor.ProcessOrder(Order order) in OrderProcessor.cs:line 45
   at OrderService.HandleNewOrder(Order order) in OrderService.cs:line 23
{code}

h2. Root Cause
The ProcessOrder method accesses order.Items.Sum() without first checking if Items is null. This occurs when orders are created through the legacy API which doesn't initialize the Items collection.

comments.body: Workaround: Manually check if order.Items is null before processing. We've added this check in the API layer for now.

fields.summary: Legacy API creates orders without initializing collections
